actions.args: {"id": 47, "body": {"name": "[Redacted] Hacker House in Chinag Mai, Thailand (October 2024)", "summary": "Proposal for the [Redacted] Hacker House in Chiang Mai, a month-long residential experience and co-working space for [Redacted] hackathon participants, NEAR\\\\\\'s presence as part of Archipelago village.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT", "kyc_verified": false, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "# NEAR Ecosystem Hacker House Proposal - Chiang Mai\\\\n\\\\n## 1. Executive Summary\\\\n\\\\nThe NEAR Ecosystem Hacker House in Chiang Mai, Thailand, is a month-long **residency** and **co-working** program designed to bring together top builders, founders, and emerging tech leaders across several web3 communities. This event is part of a larger pop-up village initiative called Archipelago, the meeting point for top talent between oken 2049 Singapore and Devcon in Bangkok in November\\\\n\\\\n## 2. Event Overview\\\\n\\\\n- **Event Name**: [Redacted] Hacker House (by NEAR Ecosystem)\\\\n- **Location**: Chiang Mai, Thailand\\\\n- **Duration**: October 1-31, 2024\\\\n- **Context**: Part of Archipelago, a larger gathering of tech communities between Token 2049 and DevCon.\\\\n\\\\nThe Hacker House is intrinsically linked to the [Redacted] Hackathon, with all participants expected to be actively working on hackathon submissions throughout their stay. It\\\\\\'s situated within the [Archipelago](https://potlock.notion.site/Archipelago-d90ea029295a4b789464243fa206fd15), a pop-up village where many communities are setting up their own hacker houses and activities. Over 600 events are expected to take place during the month.\\\\n\\\\n## 3. Objectives and Goals\\\\n- Support up to 30 submissions for the [Redacted] Hackathon\\\\n- Achieve a total participant count of 100 (including both residents and co-working daily visitors)\\\\n- Foster cross-ecosystem collaboration and knowledge sharing \\\\n- Enhance NEAR\\\\\\'s presence and reputation within the broader high-caliber blockchain community gathered for Archipelago\\\\n- Facilitate connections between NEAR projects and top builders from various blockchain ecosystems\\\\n- Increase mindshare within the existing Ethereum and wider blockchain community\\\\n- Improve community vibes and encourage extended ecosystem engagement\\\\n\\\\n## 4. Target Audience\\\\n\\\\nThe [Redacted] Hacker House aims to capitalise on the unique meeting of the minds at this time in Chinag Mai by attract and engage with the highest caliber of participants from across the blockchain space, including:\\\\n\\\\n- Top builders and founders from various blockchain ecosystems, including but not limited to NEAR\\\\n- Top-tier developers and thought leaders staying in the region for the entire month-long Archipelago event\\\\n- Established figures and emerging innovators in the blockchain and web3 space\\\\n- NEAR ecosystem members looking to collaborate and expand their network\\\\n- Wider web3 communities participating in Archipelago\\\\n- Blockchain researchers, cryptographers, and other specialized experts in town for related events\\\\n\\\\n## 5. Event Details\\\\n\\\\n### 5.1 Date and Duration\\\\n\\\\nOctober 1-31, 2024 \\\\n\\\\n### 5.2 Venue\\\\n\\\\nA large house in Chiang Mai, Thailand, serving as the main HQ:\\\\n- Sleeping Capacity: ~6\\\\n- Purpose: Hosting daily work sessions, collaborations, and events.\\\\n- Cost: $6,400 \\\\n\\\\nAdditional residential capacity will be added as close as possible to the HQ House. Enabling more [Redacted] \\\\n\\\\n### 5.3 Agenda/Schedule\\\\n\\\\nThe NEAR Ecosystem Hacker House will follow an \\\\\\\"unconference\\\\\\\" style format, with a strong focus on supporting [Redacted] Hackathon participants:\\\\n\\\\n- Participant-driven agenda: Daily schedules will be collaboratively created, focusing on sessions that support hackathon project development.\\\\n- Flexibility and spontaneity: While maintaining a hackathon focus, sessions will emerge based on participants\\\\\\' project needs and shared challenges.\\\\n- Interactive discussions: Emphasis on problem-solving workshops, code reviews, and design critiques relevant to hackathon projects.\\\\n- Open space technology: Participants can join sessions most relevant to their hackathon projects or contribute expertise to others.\\\\n- Self-organization: Attendees take responsibility for their project development while contributing to the community\\\\\\'s collective knowledge.\\\\n\\\\nCore elements will include:\\\\n- Daily standups for hackathon project progress updates and accountability\\\\n- Whiteboard sessions for product ideation and refinement\\\\n- Skillshares and mentorship opportunities focused on technologies relevant to hackathon projects\\\\n- Collaboration sessions for cross-team problem-solving\\\\n- Content creation to document the development process and showcase projects\\\\n- Flexibility to engage with broader Archipelago events that could benefit hackathon projects\\\\n\\\\n### 5.4 Capacity and Attendance\\\\n\\\\n- HQ House serving as main coworking space with capacity for daily visitors\\\\n- Sleeping capacity: ~6 in HQ, with potential for expansion based on demand\\\\n- Daily coworking capacity: Up to 30 participants \\\\n- Tracking attendance through ShardDog platform\\\\n\\\\n## 6. Budget Breakdown\\\\n\\\\nBudget Breakdown Available on [Spreadsheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1qbvH3AT-dduTCWXAM3EoP8fZyWshnQ6S8gmB0MNYp6k/edit?usp=sharing) \\\\n\\\\nNote: The budget has been adjusted to better align with available resources:\\\\n\\\\nInitial budget: $15,000\\\\nConditional additional budget: Up to $5,000 for extra sleeping capacity if needed.\\\\nTotal potential budget: $20,000\\\\nOrganiser fee to be requested separately. \\\\n\\\\n## 7. Expected Outcomes and Benefits\\\\n\\\\n- Up to 30 submissions to the [Redacted] Hackathon\\\\n- Strengthened NEAR ecosystem community and expanded network within the broader blockchain space\\\\n- Increased collaboration with other blockchain communities and projects\\\\n- Improved mindshare for NEAR within the elite blockchain builder community\\\\n- Enhanced cross-chain integrations and innovative project development\\\\n- Potential long-term partnerships and collaborations initiated during the event\\\\n\\\\n### 7.1 Measuring Success\\\\n\\\\n- Track daily attendance and unique visitors using ShardDog platform\\\\n- Monitor the number and quality of hackathon submissions\\\\n- Assess the Share of Voice (SOV) for NEAR within the Archipelago event through Social Media mentions and engagement, pieces of content created during Hacker House.\\\\n\\\\n## 8. Team and Organizers\\\\n\\\\n- AVB: Host of Wild User Interviews\\\\n- Owen: In-residence technical support, Dev Rel @ Dev Hub\\\\n- Plug: Founder at Potlock, Former Head of Decentralization at Banyan Collective, Council at Build DAO\\\\n- City Node (Hacker Box)\\\\n\\\\n## 9. Conclusion\\\\n\\\\nThe NEAR Ecosystem Hacker House in Chiang Mai represents a unique opportunity to engage with the best and brightest in web3 as they gather for a rare and precious long amount of time in between two major conferences in the region. \\\\n\\\\nBy providing a collaborative coworking environment and fostering connections within the wider Archipelago community, we aim to catalyze innovation, drive hackathon submissions, and strengthen NEAR\\\\\\'s position in the web3 ecosystem. ", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "misfitsmedia.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "20000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Event sponsorship"]}

Enabling more [Redacted] \\\\n\\\\n### 5.3 Agenda/Schedule\\\\n\\\\nThe NEAR Ecosystem Hacker House will follow an \\\\\\\"unconference\\\\\\\" style format, with a strong focus on supporting [Redacted] Hackathon participants:\\\\n\\\\n- Participant-driven agenda: Daily schedules will be collaboratively created, focusing on sessions that support hackathon project development.\\\\n- Flexibility and spontaneity: While maintaining a hackathon focus, sessions will emerge based on participants\\\\\\' project needs and shared challenges.\\\\n- Interactive discussions: Emphasis on problem-solving workshops, code reviews, and design critiques relevant to hackathon projects.\\\\n- Open space technology: Participants can join sessions most relevant to their hackathon projects or contribute expertise to others.\\\\n- Self-organization: Attendees take responsibility for their project development while contributing to the community\\\\\\'s collective knowledge.\\\\n\\\\nCore elements will include:\\\\n- Daily standups for hackathon project progress updates and accountability\\\\n- Whiteboard sessions for product ideation and refinement\\\\n- Skillshares and mentorship opportunities focused on technologies relevant to hackathon projects\\\\n- Collaboration sessions for cross-team problem-solving\\\\n- Content creation to document the development process and showcase projects\\\\n- Flexibility to engage with broader Archipelago events that could benefit hackathon projects\\\\n\\\\n### 5.4 Capacity and Attendance\\\\n\\\\n- HQ House serving as main coworking space with capacity for daily visitors\\\\n- Sleeping capacity: ~6 in HQ, with potential for expansion based on demand\\\\n- Daily coworking capacity: Up to 30 participants \\\\n- Tracking attendance through ShardDog platform\\\\n\\\\n## 6. Budget Breakdown\\\\n\\\\nBudget Breakdown Available on [Spreadsheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1qbvH3AT-dduTCWXAM3EoP8fZyWshnQ6S8gmB0MNYp6k/edit?usp=sharing) \\\\n\\\\nNote: The budget has been adjusted to better align with available resources:\\\\n\\\\nInitial budget: $15,000\\\\nConditional additional budget: Up to $5,000 for extra sleeping capacity if needed.\\\\nTotal potential budget: $20,000\\\\nOrganiser fee to be requested separately. \\\\n\\\\n## 7. Expected Outcomes and Benefits\\\\n\\\\n- Up to 30 submissions to the [Redacted] Hackathon\\\\n- Strengthened NEAR ecosystem community and expanded network within the broader blockchain space\\\\n- Increased collaboration with other blockchain communities and projects\\\\n- Improved mindshare for NEAR within the elite blockchain builder community\\\\n- Enhanced cross-chain integrations and innovative project development\\\\n- Potential long-term partnerships and collaborations initiated during the event\\\\n\\\\n### 7.1 Measuring Success\\\\n\\\\n- Track daily attendance and unique visitors using ShardDog platform\\\\n- Monitor the number and quality of hackathon submissions\\\\n- Assess the Share of Voice (SOV) for NEAR within the Archipelago event through Social Media mentions and engagement, pieces of content created during Hacker House.\\\\n\\\\n## 8. Team and Organizers\\\\n\\\\n- AVB: Host of Wild User Interviews\\\\n- Owen: In-residence technical support, Dev Rel @ Dev Hub\\\\n- Plug: Founder at Potlock, Former Head of Decentralization at Banyan Collective, Council at Build DAO\\\\n- City Node (Hacker Box)\\\\n\\\\n## 9. Conclusion\\\\n\\\\nThe NEAR Ecosystem Hacker House in Chiang Mai represents a unique opportunity to engage with the best and brightest in web3 as they gather for a rare and precious long amount of time in between two major conferences in the region. \\\\n\\\\nBy providing a collaborative coworking environment and fostering connections within the wider Archipelago community, we aim to catalyze innovation, drive hackathon submissions, and strengthen NEAR\\\\\\'s position in the web3 ecosystem. {"body": {"name": "Travel Stipend for Lin participating in the IRL [REDACTED] Hackathon", "summary": "I\\\\\\'m Henry, a full-stack developer and tech entrepreneur from New York. I\\\\\\'m requesting a travel stipend to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok. I\\\\\\'ve won the NEAR MetaBuidl Hackathon III (Waver Finance) and was a finalist in ETHGlobal LFG (Adfuel). With experience developing smart contracts on NEAR, I plan to contribute innovative projects to the NEAR ecosystem.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "Im applying for the overseas travel stipend of up to 1000 to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok, Thailand. As a developer based in New York, this support is crucial for my participation.\\\\n\\\\n- https://devpost.com/software/waver-finance NEAR MetaBUILD III Hackathon: Winner Native Track Prizes | Honorable Mentions\\\\n- https://ethglobal.com/showcase/adfuel-5edoy ETHGlobal - \\\\u{1f3c6} LFGHO Finalist https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tEKQqmg4-w8&t=790s Finalist demo pitching (starts at 13 min)\\\\n- I used to be the Co-Founder of NEAR Tinker Union and I build all the smart contracts of our NFT project and Enleap NFT launchpad.\\\\n\\\\nTravel Details\\\\n\\\\nDeparture: New York, US\\\\nDestination: Bangkok, Thailand\\\\n\\\\n### Estimated Costs:\\\\n\\\\nFlight: 1000 (actually 1200+ from JFK airport to Bangkok)\\\\nI will pay myself for other cost\\\\n\\\\n### Timeline and Commitments\\\\n\\\\nDevelop and submit an eligible project\\\\nUpdate this proposal with Devpost submission URL\\\\nAttend the IRL event in person\\\\n\\\\n### Fund Utilization\\\\n\\\\nThe stipend will directly cover travel expenses, ensuring my ability to attend and contribute to the hackathon. Any remaining funds will be used for accommodation or additional development resources.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "opshenry.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 129478111}

{"body": {"name": "Travel Stipend [REDACTED] Movement - Bangkok, Nov. 2024", "summary": "Hey, I am Megha, an experienced NEAR developer from India, applying for a travel stipend to attend the [REDACTED] event in Bangkok, Thailand. I plan to travel from Delhi, India, to participate in person. My goal is to contribute to the hackathon by submitting an innovative project that aligns with the event\\\\\\'s submission criteria.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "## Purpose\\\\nI am applying for the overseas travel stipend of $950 to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok, Thailand.\\\\n\\\\n## My Records\\\\nI have actively contributed to multiple projects within the NEAR ecosystem in the last 3 years, including [Devhub](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos), [NearBuilders](https://github.com/NEARBuilders), and [NDC](https://github.com/orgs/near-ndc). I also hold a top 10 position on the Race of Sloths [leaderboard]((https://race-of-sloths.com/leaderboard), and my work can be explored further on my [GitHub](https://github.com/Megha-Dev-19).\\\\n\\\\n## Travel Itinerary and Estimated Costs\\\\nDeparture: Delhi, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand (8th November)\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Delhi, India (14th November)\\\\n\\\\n#### Estimated Costs Breakdown\\\\nFlights: $600 USD\\\\nAccommodation: $200 USD\\\\nOther Costs (Food + Transport): $150 USD\\\\nTotal Estimated Cost: $950 USD\\\\n\\\\n## Project Plan\\\\nI am currently preparing a project that aligns with the goals of the [REDACTED] hackathon, which I will submit through Devpost. Once submitted, I will update this proposal with the URL to my project submission.\\\\n\\\\nYour support will enable me to attend and contribute to this exciting event. Thank you for your consideration, and I look forward to seeing you there!\\\\n\\\\nMegha", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "megha19.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "950", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 129488092}
